entity.Name: Incident

Description.description: Service request case associated with a contract.
Indicates whether the activities completed or not.
This attribute is used for Sample Service Business Processes.
Select how contact about the case was originated, such as email, phone, or web, for use in reporting and analysis.
Information that specifies the type of case.
Select the type of case to identify the incident for use in case routing and analysis.
Indicates whether the check email is set to default or not.
This attribute is used for Sample Service Business Processes.
Choose the contract line that the case should be logged under to make sure the customer is charged correctly.
Choose the service contract that the case should be logged under to make sure the customer is eligible for support services.
Response level for the case. The response level corresponds to the level of service specified in the contract.
Select the service level for the case to make sure the case is handled correctly.
Shows who created the record.
Shows the external party who created the record.
Select the customer account or contact to provide a quick link to additional customer details, such as account information, activities, and opportunities.
Customer's level of satisfaction with the resolution of the case.
Select the customer's level of satisfaction with the handling and resolution of the case.
Shows whether terms of the associated entitlement should be decremented or not.
Shows whether terms of the associated entitlement should be decremented or not.
Type additional information to describe the case to assist the service team in reaching a resolution.
Indicates if the first response has been sent.
Indicates if the first response has been sent.
First Response SLA Status
Shows the status of the initial response time for the case according to the terms of the SLA.

displayname.description: Is there any follow up task with case

Description.description: Indicates whether the follow up task is created or not.
This attribute is used for Sample Service Business Processes.
Alternative brand of Unit (other than OTIS)
Alternative brand of Unit (other than OTIS)
Field used to indicate whether the customer requires Acknowledgement & Updates to be completed in a 3rd Party Work Order system
Advise Customer to Stay in Elevator - Field is used to identify if CSR completed 3 step process for Entrapment Case Types.
Name of the Account associated with Unit
This is the Yomi name of the Account
Checkbox to assign the task/notification to the Branch Manager selected
This field is used to assign a task to the Branch Queue
This field is used to assign a task to the Manitenance Supervisor
Checkbox to assign the task/notification to the Maintenance Supervisor selected
This field is used to assign a task to the Sales Rep
Checkbox to assign the task/notification to the Sales Rep selected
Flag to override Auto Assignment of a Work Order
Field for the user to confirm if the caller agrees to pay the billable charges.
Field for the user to confirm if the caller agrees to pay the billable charges.
Determines the Ownership of Field service work orders related to the Cases/Units
This field shows the different Communication Reasons for a Branch Communication case
Brand associated with Branch
Physical address of the building where the unit is located
Unique identifier for Account and Building associated with Case.
Where the Primary phone is located in the building
When 'Button' is selected as the Malfunction Sub Type, this field will display options to select the area of button malfunction
When 'Button' is selected as the Malfunction Sub Type, this field will display options to select the area of button malfunction
This is the contact who iniated the creation of the case
The reason for creation of Case
Indicates whether the customer has threatened to cancel their contract or completed an action that is likely to lead to cancellation.
This field is used to provide additional details related to a cancellation alert

label.description: Customer Signed with Another Service Provider
Dissatisfied with Otis Responsiveness to ETA’s
Lack or Failure of Communication from Otis

Description.description: Reason for the Cancellation Alert
Cancellation Alert reason lookup to the trigerring event on the Opportunity
Channel for the Case
Subtype of the Case for Field Inquiry Case Type
Categorizes the case. When the Case Type has data in the Category Type field it is set in the Case record automatically.
Unique identifier for Case associated with Case.
How the Contact on a Case prefers to be communicated with specifically regarding the Service Request
Contact Feedback Type
When gsscore_calltype = Customer/Other, this field will display as an Option Set to select the type of reported issue
When gsscore_calltype = Customer/Other, this field will display as an Option Set to select the type of reported issue
Undefined until Contract Discussion
Contact Temperature of the Customer
Captures the customer's work order number from the 3rd party work order system
To indicate the DateTime until which the Word Order is deferred
Case Additional Details
When 'Door' is selected as the Malfunction Sub Type, this field will display options to select the area of door malfunction
When 'Door' is selected as the Malfunction Sub Type, this field will display options to select the area of door malfunction
To determine duration elapsed from the Email received to Case creation
Field is used by CSR to identify if emergency services were contacted for Safety Issue/Hazard, Entrapment, Alleged Injury, and Possible Entrapment case types.
This fields provides a reason for dispatching emergency services for a possible entrapment or an entrapment
This fields provides a reason for dispatching emergency services for a possible entrapment or an entrapment
Time that the Engineer arrives onsite for the first time.
Estimated Time of Arrival Identified by the Engineer on the Workorder
To indicate the floor on the case form
This field is used to indicate whether further service is required when a Service Request needs to be cancelled/downgraded/modified
Field is used by CSR to Identify if the door has been barricaded for "Safety Issue hazard Sub Type" cases of Open Hoistway
When gsscore_calltype = Malfunction, this field will display as an Option Set to select the type of reported malfunction
When gsscore_calltype = Malfunction, this field will display as an Option Set to select the type of reported malfunction
This fields lets the CSR Indicate if the passenger sought medical attention for an Alleged Injury Case.
This fields lets the CSR Indicate if the passenger sought medical attention for an Alleged Injury Case.
If Other was selected for Emergency Services Dispatch Reason, CSR can input description of reason here.
A flag which forces the generated Work Orders to observe overtime SLA rules.
The preferred method of communication specifically related to Case follow up
Beginning time for T1 calculation
Latest time of arrival (promised from time plus the SLA in business hours)
Field is used to Identify the Safety Issue / Hazard Sub-Type.
Is there a potential opportunity for cross-sell or up-sell of Otis products and services?
This is field is to capture additional details for the Sales Opportunity
This field is used to capture the Sales Opportunity Reason for a Sales Opportunity
Identifies whether Unit is in service or out of service.
To indicate the Severity Customer Feedback case type
Did engineering satisfy the SLA?
This is field is for Special Instructions on an Acccount
This is field is for Special Instructions on a Building
This is field is for Special Instructions on a Unit
Field is used to provide description for Other Safety Issue / Hazzard Sub-Type
To indicate that the CSR completed the 3 step process
This is the Unit the Case is created for.
This field will allow the user to record on a case that the case has been updated in a customer's 3rd Party Work Order system
This field will allow the user to record on a case that the case has been updated in a customer's 3rd Party Work Order system
This field is to indicate if there was Vandalism Reported
Stage of the resolution process for the case.
Select the current stage of the service process for the case to assist service team members when they review or transfer a case.
Information that specifies whether the case is decrementing.
For system use only.
Indicates if the case has been escalated.
Indicates if the case has been escalated.
Information regarding whether the incident has been merged with a master incident.
Tells whether the incident has been merged with another incident.
Shows who last updated the record.
Shows the external party who modified the record.
Unique identifier for Incident Type associated with Case.
Priority of the case.
Select the priority so that preferred customers or critical issues are handled quickly.
ResolveBy SLA Status
Shows the status of the resolution time for the case according to the terms of the SLA.
Information regarding whether the incident has been routed.
Tells whether the incident has been routed to queue or not.
Severity of the case.
Select the severity of this case to indicate the incident's impact on the customer's business.
Choose the service level agreement (SLA) that you want to apply to the case record.
Status of the case.
Shows whether the case is active, resolved, or canceled. Resolved and canceled cases are read-only and can't be edited unless they are reactivated.
Reason for the status of the case.
Select the case's status.
Shows the case number for customer reference and searching capabilities. This cannot be modified.
Type a subject or descriptive name, such as the request, issue, or company name, to identify the case in Microsoft Dynamics 365 views.

entity.MobileOfflineFilters: <fetch version="1.0" output-format="xml-platform" mapping="logical" distinct="false"> <entity name="incident"> <filter type="and"> <condition attribute="modifiedon" operator="last-x-days" value="10"/> </filter> </entity> </fetch>
